project.teaser: INSPIRE's main objective is to contribute to the drastic reduction of litter, macro and microplastics in European rivers in a holistic approach, by bringing together 20 technologies and actions for:DETECTION of the pollution present in the river and at the riverbank...
project.objective: INSPIRE's main objective is to contribute to the drastic reduction of litter, macro and microplastics in European rivers in a holistic approach, by bringing together 20 technologies and actions for: DETECTION of the pollution present in the river and at the riverbank, COLLECTION of litter and macroplastics at the river bank and litter, macro and microplastics in the river, PREVENTION of litter, macro and microplastics to enter the river by collecting it from its waste stream before it can enter the river and by developing biodegradable alternatives for currently non-degradable polluting products, to avoid they will further be used and arrive in the river as litter. Six use case are defined in INSPIRE to install and test the technologies and actions, to model the processes related to the water purification activities, to obtain 7 well defined solutions at detection, collection or prevention level and combinations thereof. The technical feasibility is backboned by a techno-economical analysis with the development of business cases for the solutions, action plans towards upscaling and replication and together with mapping and modelling all elements are brought together to develop a Master Plan for tackling the challenges of the mission and contributing to the objectives of the mission. The INSPIRE project will be very visible due to its well developed dissemination and communication plan and strategy for community engagement. Apart from the general dissemination and communication tools and activities, specific activities will be setup on festivals, promoting 100% biodegradable products as a result of INSPIRE. INSPIRE's consortium is composed of 26 partners with complementary expertise and a good balance of academia, industry, communication specialists and soft skills organisations is obtained, who all together will work towards the target of having a number of successful solutions that can find their way to the market and put INSPIRE on the radar.
project.title: Innovative Solutions for Plastic Free European Rivers
project.keywords: Microplastics, macroplastics, litter, clean rivers, clean oceans, detection, collection, prevention

article.title: A holistic solution to safeguard the future of our rivers

category.title: Project description
category.description: Article: description of linked project written by editorial team

result.title: Community engagement, commun. and dissem. strategy
result.description: Outline of a community engagement, communication and dissemination strategy for an integrated strategy to produce long-term impacts of the INSPIRE targets. Deliverable based on T6.1

result.title: Antifouling activity of PEGylated chitosan coatings: Impacts of the side chain length and encapsulated ZnO/Ag nanoparticles

details.authors: Dongkun Yu, Fei Ye, Sergey Dobretsov, Joydeep Dutta

result.title: Report on feedback loop including impact pathways generated by measures for prevention
result.description: Report on creation of feedback loop in order to allow progressive insights. An assessment will take place both before and after implementing the measures, enabling innovation providers to validate their solutions and improve effectiveness by means of optimisation, which will be adjusted based on the specifics of each case.Assessment will also have to consider various parameters to measure efficiency: power consumption, required maintenance time, and required operator time. Deliverable based on T4.1

result.title: Periodic Reporting for period 1 - INSPIRE (Innovative Solutions for Plastic Free European Rivers)
result.teaser: INSPIRE's main objective is to contribute to the drastic reduction of litter, macro and microplastics in European rivers in a holistic approach, by bringing together 20 technologies and actions for:DETECTION of the pollution present in the river and at the riverbank,COLLECTION...

category.title: Report Summary
category.description: Result: Publishable summary (FP7 SESAM) and Summary for publication (H2020 SyGMa)

result.title: Plan to implement the technical coordination of INSPIRE
result.description: The plan covers the work plan tasks to implement the project and to allow progress monitoring. It also covers the measures taken for deviations from the initial work plan and how this affects the overall work plan, budget, etc

result.title: Combined exposure of poly(lactic-co-glycolic acid) microplastics and global warming affects the population dynamics of a coastal copepod

details.authors: Niu, Z.; Asselman, J.; Janssen, C.; Linley, C.P.; De Schamphelaere, K.; Everaert, G.; Catarino, A.

result.title: Open call documents kit & third-party financing rules
result.description: Open call description & tender for an effective, transparent, objective and fair procedure in selecting the local stakeholders from Associated Regions (AR) and managing the Financial Support to Third Parties (FSTP). Deliverable based on T5.3

result.title: Plan to implement actions for Coordination of INSPIRE
result.description: The plan covers the different actions, development of tools and reporting templates, timing plan for consortium meetings, etc .

result.title: Project website
result.description: Report on the features included in the project website, covering the concept of the INSPIRE project, the partners, news about the topic, reporting about events organized, results obtained and general communications about the project.

result.title: Monitoring and analysis protocols
result.description: Description: Protocols for effective monitoring at the demo sites will be developed and will comprise of sampling site selection, sampling techniques, analytical protocols and quality assurance.

result.title: Communication kit
result.description: The communication kit contains a number of communication tools that each partner can use for communication about INSPIRE and that will be used for promoting INSPIRE on events. The kit contains a digital flyer, sustainable gadgets, project presentation press release, ppt and video (call-to action video and final video of the project).

result.title: Development of retention efficiency protocols
result.description: Description: Description of protocols to be used to objectively assess the retention efficiency of plastic removal technologies.

result.title: Characterization of Poly(3-hydroxybutyrate) (P3HB) from Alternative, Scalable (Waste) Feedstocks

details.authors: Rogerio Ramos de Sousa Junior, Fabiano Eduardo Marques Cezario, Leonardo Dalseno Antonino, Demetrio Jackson dos Santos, Maximilian Lackner

result.title: Data Management Plan
result.description: The data Management Plan covers the plan on how to manage data from data collection, over data storage, data handling, data analysis and data sharing, including the technical actions to be taken to realize the data management plan. The DMP also describes the FAIR principles and data protection measures to be implemented.

result.title: Performance of zero-valent iron immobilized on activated carbon cloth for the removal of phenol from wastewater

details.authors: Muhammad Yusuf Suleiman; Opeoluwa Olusola Fasanya; Abdulazeez Yusuf Atta; Fei Ye; Joydeep Dutta; Baba El-Yakubu Jibril

result.title: Performance indicators
result.description: Introduction to the quantitative performance indicators used to monitor the community engagement, communication and dissemination strategy. Deliverable based on T6.1

result.title: Leachates from weathered polypropylene items, but not from polylactic acid, induce ecotoxicological effects on a marine diatom

details.authors: Zhiyue Niu, Sol Anglada Segura, Maelenn Le Gall, Marco Curto, Elke Demeyer, Jana Asselman, Colin R. Janssen, Dhakal Hom, Peter Davies, Gert Everaert, Ana Isabel Catarino
details.publisher: Springer Science and Business Media LLC

category.title: pollution
category.displayCode: /natural sciences/earth and related environmental sciences/environmental sciences/pollution

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
